title: Arnold Schwarzenegger jokes he felt intimidated by son-in-law Chris Pratt
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Arnold Schwarzenegger is the proud father-in-law of the Avengers star Chris Pratt.

However, it turns out he was slightly intimidated by the actor when he first started to date the 72-year-old’s daughter Katherine.

Chatting on Jimmy Kimmel Live, Arnie spoke about his new family dynamic and how he was won over by the 40-year-old.

Making it clear that they’re on good terms, he said: ‘First of all, I’m really happy that he is such a great guy.

‘Not only a very talented guy, and a great actor, and a great star, and all this stuff, but a really kind man and kind to my daughter, which is the most important thing for me.’

He laughed: ‘I was blown away when my daughter was telling me that she was going out with him.’

Arnold Schwarzenegger jokes he felt intimidated by son-in-law Chris Pratt (Picture: Getty)

The Avengers star won over Arnie by pumping iron (Picture: Getty Images)

Joking about his reaction, the father-of-five quipped: ‘I was just like, “Do you have to be so competitive? I mean, do you have to have a guy that is taller than me, that is bigger than me, that is doing bigger movies than me”.’

Pausing for a moment, the bodybuilder went on to add: ‘Makes more money than me and all this kind of stuff? What is going on here?’

But Chris managed to win over his new father-in-law by pumping iron in the gym – because of course he did.

Arnie said: ‘The first thing when we met, he said, “Can we have a workout together? I need to have the inside scoop to the pumping iron.”‘

Kimmel quizzed whether this was the deciding factor as to whether or not he could marry his daughter, to which the star chuckled: ‘Pumping iron was the decision-making factor, absolutely.’

He tied the knot with Katerine earlier this year (Picture: Getty Images)

He said: ‘We were in the gym, that was it … He’s a strong guy, there’s no two ways about it. I’m very proud of him.

‘When I watched him make his moves in the gym, the incline press specifically did it. That’s why I wanted him to become my son-in-law.’

Advertisement

Katherine tied the knot with Chris in June this year, after he went to Arnie for permission.

‘Chris asked for Maria Shriver and Arnold Schwarzenegger’s permission around Christmas,’ an insider claimed to Us Weekly. ‘Maria helped him with the proposal.’

Guests at the wedding included Chris’ son Jack, six, who he shares with ex Anna Faris, and Katherine’s brothers Patrick and Christopher, along with her sister Christina.

‘Everyone just looked so happy,’ an insider revealed at the time: ‘You can tell today is the happiest day for Katherine. She hasn’t stopped smiling.’

They added that Guardians of the Galaxy star Chris was ‘giddy with excitement’ and the couple exchanged vows in a ‘very romantic setting’.
